009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
020import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.EigenDecompositionJama;
021import imagingbook.common.util.SortMap;
022
023public class OrthogonalLineFitEigen implements LineFit {
024        
025        public static boolean VERBOSE = false;
026        
027        private final int n;
028        private final double[] p;       // line parameters A,B,C
029        
030        public OrthogonalLineFitEigen(Pnt2d[] points) {
031                if (points.length < 2) {
032                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
033                }
034                this.n = points.length;
035                this.p = fit(points);
036        }
037        
038        @Override
039        public int getSize() {
040                return n;
041        }
042
043        @Override
044        public double[] getLineParameters() {
045                return p;
046        }
047        
048        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points) {
049                final int n = points.length;
050        
051                double Sx = 0, Sy = 0, Sxx = 0, Syy = 0, Sxy = 0;
052                
053                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
054                        final double x = points[i].getX();
055                        final double y = points[i].getY();
056                        Sx += x;
057                        Sy += y;
058                        Sxx += sqr(x);
059                        Syy += sqr(y);
060                        Sxy += x * y;
061                }
062                
063                double sxx = Sxx - sqr(Sx) / n;
064                double syy = Syy - sqr(Sy) / n;
065                double sxy = Sxy - Sx * Sy / n;
066                
067                double[][] S = {
068                                {sxx, sxy},
069                                {sxy, syy} 
070                };
071                
072                
073//              RealEigensolver es = new EigensolverNxN(S);
074                EigenDecompositionJama es = new EigenDecompositionJama(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(S));
075//              double[] e = es.getEigenvector(1);
076                int k = SortMap.getNthSmallestIndex(es.getRealEigenvalues(), 0);
077                double[] e = es.getEigenvector(k).toArray();
078                
079                double A = e[0];
080                double B = e[1];
081                double C = -(A * Sx + B * Sy) / n;
082                
083                if (VERBOSE) {
084                        System.out.println("Sx = " + Sx);
085                        System.out.println("Sy = " + Sy);
086                        System.out.println("xc = " + PntUtils.centroid(points));
087                        System.out.println("S = \n" + Matrix.toString(S));
088//                      System.out.println("eVal = " + Matrix.toString(es.getEigenvalues()));
089//                      System.out.println("eVec = \n" + Matrix.toString(es.getEigenvectors()));
090                        System.out.println("eVal = " + Matrix.toString(es.getRealEigenvalues()));
091                        System.out.println("eVec = \n" + Matrix.toString(es.getV()));
092                        System.out.println("A = \n" + A);
093                        System.out.println("B = \n" + B);
094                        System.out.println("C = \n" + C);
095                }
096                return new double[] {A, B, C};
097        }
098
099        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
100        
101//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }, { 18, 2 }, { 7, 1 }, { 5, 6 }};
102//      static double[][] X = {{ 10, 6 }, { 4, 3 }};
103//      static double[][] X = {{ 1, 1 }, { 3, 3 },  { 13, 13 }};
104        static double[][] X = {{1, 8}, {4, 5}, {4, 7}, {6, 4}, {9, 4}}; // book example
105//      static double[][] X = {{1, 8}, {4, 5}};
106        
107        public static void main(String[] args) {
108                VERBOSE = true;
109                PrintPrecision.set(4);
110                Pnt2d[] pts = PntUtils.fromDoubleArray(X);      
111                LineFit fit = new OrthogonalLineFitEigen(pts);
112                AlgebraicLine line = fit.getLine();
113                System.out.println("line = " +  Matrix.toString(line.getParameters()));
114                System.out.println("mean square error = " + fit.getSquaredOrthogonalError(pts) / X.length);
115        }
116
117        // class Fitting_Lines.lib.OrthogonalLineFitEigen
118        // line = {-0.4969, -0.8678, 7.2448}
119        // square error = 2.6645834350486606
120        // mean square error = 0.5329166870097322
121}
122
123/*
124Sx = 24.0
125Sy = 28.0
126xc = PntDouble[4.800, 5.600]
127S = 
128{{34.8000, -18.4000}, 
129{-18.4000, 13.2000}}
130eVal = {2.6646, 45.3354}
131eVec = 
132{{-0.4969, 0.8678}, 
133{-0.8678, -0.4969}}
134A = 
135-0.4968900437902618
136B = 
137-0.8678135078357052
138C = 
1397.244827854073206
140line = {0.4969, 0.8678, -7.2448}
141mean square error = 0.5329166870097322
142*/
